Math480_Homework6
=================
Problem 1:

The secret number is 2^(mn) (mod p) = (2^m)^n (mod p).

Writing these codes in Sage:

p = next_prime(2^(127)-1)

n = 123456

TwoM = 89646952373925749567894332598989134553

Mod(TwoM,p)^n

The answer is 79067655658429219567805855344438774741.

------------------

Problem 2:

I will send m^e (mod n) where m = 123456.

Running these codes:

e = 242625000543782734131923137798600594026156114633596788154356432719346943151066766403

n = 242833611528216133864932738352939863371691062980744245396143908889432040840714260647

m = 123456

Mod(m,e)^n

It turns out the ciphertext is 105400145933695947423656035277573335300224031906944607713098742896173281888615756219.
